title: Clinical Procedures in Emergency Medicine
role_in_edaitutor: Procedural reference for stepwise ED procedures, sedation, and complication management.

chapters.summary: Outlines general principles that apply to all emergency procedures, including preparation, consent, equipment, monitoring, and management of complications.
Covers core airway procedures performed in the ED, focusing on indications, preparation, technique, and complication management.
Describes thoracic procedures used to manage pneumothorax, pleural effusion, and other acute thoracic conditions in the ED.
Provides practical guidance for obtaining vascular access in routine and resuscitation scenarios, with an emphasis on ultrasound-guided techniques.
Summarises ED procedural sedation practices, including drug regimens, monitoring requirements, and management of respiratory or haemodynamic complications.
Discusses practical technique for joint reductions, splint and cast application, and joint aspiration in the ED.
Provides stepwise guidance for wound closure, abscess drainage, and associated soft tissue procedures in emergency care.
Describes common minor procedures in ophthalmology and ENT relevant to ED practice.
